alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 1:52PM MDT until July 28 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Jackson County, including the Mullen burn scar. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches will be possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Jackson County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in the Mullen burn scar.
